page.title: 13Offwell Church
page.content: The parish church is dedicated to St Mary. Built of flint and stone, it was built in the 13th century. There is a service every Sunday morning with Evening Prayer once a month. Usually about 30 people attend. Bells are rung before all services by six ringers, three from the same family. The church is used for Baptisms, Weddings, Funerals and for school services. Being the oldest and largest building in the village, it costs a great deal to maintain. Voluntary contributions from the parishioners are the only source of income. The Rector lives in{Offwell}and is also responsible for the three neighbouring parishes of {Widworthy, {Cotleigh }and {Southleigh. { {
